TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A part of the middle layer of the wall of the eye. The ciliary body includes the ring-shaped muscle that changes the size of the pupil and the shape of the lens when the eye focuses. It also makes the fluid that fills the eye.

MediaLink.alt: Eye anatomy; two-panel drawing shows the outside and inside of the eye. The top panel shows outside of the eye including the eyelid, pupil, sclera, and iris; the bottom panel shows inside of the eye including the cornea, lens, ciliary body, retina, choroid, optic nerve, and vitreous humor.

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Parte de la capa intermedia de la pared del ojo. El cuerpo ciliar incluye el músculo con forma de anillo que cambia el tamaño de la pupila y la forma de la lente cuando se enfoca el ojo. También elabora el líquido que baña el ojo.
